Feature: Neighborhood Layer Value Recognition for Retired Person
  As a retired person in the value scanner system
  Operating at the neighborhood governance layer
  I want my neighborhood contributions recognized and participation supported
  So that I remain embedded in community life and help build neighborhood resilience

  Background:
    Given the Elohim Protocol is operational
    And the retired user "Frank" is registered in the system
    And Frank is 70 years old, retired from construction
    And Frank serves on his neighborhood council
    And the neighborhood governance context is active
    And the neighborhood_elohim coordinates neighborhood care economy
    And Frank's time freedom enables substantial neighborhood participation

  Scenario: Neighborhood council service recognized as civic care contribution
    Given Frank serves on his neighborhood council
    And he attends meetings, participates in decisions, and contributes expertise
    And council service requires time, knowledge, and commitment
    When the neighborhood_elohim tracks civic participation
    Then Frank's council service should be quantified as care labor
    And meeting attendance and preparation time should be valued
    And his construction expertise contributions should be recognized
    And governance participation should accumulate care tokens
    And Frank should experience himself as valued neighborhood leader
    And civic engagement should be recognized as care economy contribution
    And his voice in neighborhood governance should carry appropriate weight

  Scenario: Accumulated community knowledge valued in neighborhood governance
    Given Frank has lived in the neighborhood for decades
    And he knows neighborhood history, patterns, and relationships
    And institutional knowledge is valuable governance resource
    When Frank participates in neighborhood decisions
    Then his accumulated knowledge should be recognized and valued
    And long-term perspective should inform neighborhood planning
    And the neighborhood_elohim should surface relevant historical context
    And Frank's memory of neighborhood patterns should guide policy
    And elder knowledge should shape community decisions
    And decades of participation should confer legitimate standing
    And his experience should be actively sought, not marginalized

  Scenario: Neighborhood repairs and maintenance using construction skills
    Given Frank has construction expertise
    And neighborhoods need ongoing maintenance and repairs
    And Frank's time freedom enables contribution
    When the neighborhood_elohim coordinates maintenance needs
    Then it should connect Frank's skills to neighborhood repair opportunities
    And coordinate small repair projects utilizing his expertise
    And recognize his skilled labor as valuable contribution
    And facilitate tool sharing and material coordination
    And quantify the market value of construction skills applied
    And enable Frank to contribute meaningfully to neighborhood quality
    And his skills should serve collective neighborhood benefit

  Scenario: Neighborhood care tokens reflect accumulated contributions
    Given Frank contributes through council service, repairs, and relationship-building
    And he's invested decades in neighborhood relationships
    When the neighborhood_elohim calculates care tokens
    Then tokens should accumulate from all Frank's neighborhood contributions
    And governance participation, skilled labor, and social cohesion work should be valued
    And accumulated tokens should represent neighborhood standing and resources
    And Frank's contributions should create claims on neighborhood support
    And the care economy should recognize long-term neighborhood investment
    And his participation should be visible and celebrated

  Scenario: Connecting retired residents for mutual support networks
    Given Frank is one of several retired residents in the neighborhood
    And retired people have time to build mutual support systems
    When the neighborhood_elohim coordinates among retired residents
    Then it should help Frank connect with other retired neighbors
    And facilitate mutual aid networks among those with time availability
    And coordinate skill sharing across retired residents
    And support check-in systems for isolated or vulnerable neighbors
    And build neighborhood resilience through retired resident networks
    And enable Frank to both give and receive neighborhood support

  Scenario: Neighborhood governance participation accessible to aging residents
    Given Frank is aging and may have mobility or accessibility needs
    And neighborhood governance should remain accessible
    When Frank participates in neighborhood governance
    Then meetings should be accessible (location, seating, acoustics)
    And remote participation options should be available
    And meeting materials should be provided in accessible formats
    And the neighborhood_elohim should coordinate accessibility needs
    And Frank should be able to participate fully despite aging
    And governance access should be universal, not assuming youth
    And his participation should be welcomed and supported

  Scenario: Mentoring younger neighbors in practical skills and neighborhood knowledge
    Given Frank has construction expertise and decades of neighborhood knowledge
    And younger neighbors are establishing themselves in the community
    When the neighborhood_elohim facilitates mentoring
    Then it should connect Frank to younger neighbors seeking skills
    And coordinate skill-sharing for home repairs and maintenance
    And facilitate neighborhood history and culture transmission
    And recognize teaching and mentoring as care contributions
    And build intergenerational neighborhood relationships
    And value Frank's role in acculturating new residents
    And strengthen neighborhood cohesion through knowledge sharing

  Scenario: Neighborhood emergency response utilizes retired residents' availability
    Given Frank has daytime availability when many neighbors work
    And neighborhoods need emergency response capacity
    When the neighborhood_elohim coordinates emergency preparedness
    Then it should include Frank in neighborhood emergency plans
    And utilize his construction skills for emergency assessment
    And coordinate check-ins on vulnerable neighbors during crises
    And recognize retired residents as neighborhood resilience resources
    And Frank should feel valuable in emergency response role
    And his availability should serve collective security
    And neighborhood should benefit from his time flexibility

  Scenario: Neighborhood beautification and common space maintenance
    Given Frank has time and skills to contribute to neighborhood spaces
    And common spaces require ongoing care and maintenance
    When the neighborhood_elohim coordinates common space work
    Then it should facilitate Frank's participation in beautification
    And coordinate neighborhood workdays utilizing his skills
    And recognize landscaping, repair, and maintenance as care labor
    And value his contributions to neighborhood quality of life
    And enable collective ownership of neighborhood commons
    And Frank should experience meaningful contribution to place
    And neighborhood should benefit from retired residents' time

  Scenario: Neighborhood social cohesion work valued as care contribution
    Given Frank builds relationships across the neighborhood
    And he organizes informal gatherings and supports connections
    And social cohesion is essential neighborhood infrastructure
    When the neighborhood_elohim tracks relationship-building work
    Then Frank's social cohesion labor should be recognized
    And organizing gatherings, welcoming newcomers, maintaining connections should be valued
    And the invisible work of community-building should be quantified
    And Frank should experience his relationship work as valuable contribution
    And neighborhood resilience should be understood as built through care labor
    And his decades of relationship investment should be visible

  Scenario: Neighborhood resource sharing facilitated by retired residents' coordination
    Given Frank has time to coordinate neighborhood resource sharing
    And tool libraries, skill exchanges, and mutual aid require coordination
    When the neighborhood_elohim supports resource sharing
    Then it should enable Frank to help coordinate shared resources
    And facilitate tool borrowing, skill trades, and favor exchanges
    And recognize coordination labor as valuable care contribution
    And reduce neighborhood consumption through effective sharing
    And Frank's coordination work should build neighborhood resilience
    And his time availability should serve collective resource efficiency

  Scenario: Aging in place supported by neighborhood care infrastructure
    Given Frank plans to age in his neighborhood
    And neighborhoods can support aging in place through care economy
    When the neighborhood_elohim coordinates aging support
    Then it should connect Frank to neighbors who can provide future support
    And facilitate reciprocal care arrangements as needs change
    And coordinate check-ins and assistance for aging residents
    And Frank's current contributions should create future neighborhood support
    And care reciprocity should operate at neighborhood scale
    And aging in place should be supported through neighborhood care economy
    And Frank should experience security in continuing neighborhood membership
